clause_text: This agreement defines the terms of employment between the employer and the employee based on mutual confidence and lawful conduct.
The Company and Employee enter into this agreement to define the terms and conditions of employment.
The Employee is appointed to the position specified by the Company upon execution of this agreement.
The Company may change the Employees position, responsibilities, or work location based on business needs or performance.
The first specified days of employment shall constitute a probationary period.
During probation, the Employer may terminate employment without notice or reason.
After probation, the Employer may confirm the Employees employment at its sole discretion.
After probation, this agreement may be terminated in accordance with Clause 12.
The Employee shall devote full business time to the Company and perform duties faithfully and efficiently.
The Employee shall endeavor to meet goals and performance parameters set by the Company.
The Employee shall be compensated with a salary payable monthly or more frequently as per the Employer’s convenience.
The salary amount may be increased from time to time as determined by the Employer.
Salary payments are subject to statutory deductions by the Employer.
Salary shall be paid via bank transfer, cheque, or other method convenient to the Employer.
Authorized employment-related expenses shall be reimbursed upon receipt submission.
The Employee shall not engage in theft, fraud, misrepresentation, or illegal acts.
The Company shall not be liable for illegal acts committed by the Employee.
The Employee shall not steal or attempt to defraud the Employer.
The Employee shall comply with Company rules, regulations, and policies.
The Employee shall not engage in part-time or full-time employment elsewhere during this agreement.
The Employee shall not engage in sexual harassment and is responsible for any violations.
The Employee is entitled to paid casual leave, sick leave, and public holidays as per policy.
Leave cannot be carried forward or encashed.
The Employee must inform the Employer in case of sickness or injury.
Medical certification is required for sickness beyond seven days.
Only statutory sick pay will be provided during sickness or injury.
All work and intellectual property created during employment belong to the Employer.
The Employee must execute documents to vest IP rights in the Employer.
The Employee shall not engage in competing businesses during employment and for one year after termination.
The Employee shall not disclose confidential information during or after employment.
All intellectual property developed during employment belongs to the Employer.
The Employer may terminate payments if covenants are violated.
The Employer is entitled to injunctive relief for covenant breaches.
The Employer must provide notice or pay in lieu if terminating without cause.
The Employee must provide advance notice before resigning.
Termination may occur upon death, cause, or disability.
Cause includes misconduct, theft, fraud, or material breach.
The Employee shall not solicit clients or employees for three years post-termination.
The Employee shall not divulge financial information post-termination.
Notices shall be delivered personally or via registered mail.
Employee interests may not be assigned.
This agreement binds successor employers.
The Employee shall indemnify the Employer against legal claims.
Modifications must be in writing and signed by both parties.
Invalid clauses do not affect the remainder of the agreement.
Paragraph headings are for convenience only.
The agreement is governed by applicable law and jurisdiction.
The agreement may be executed in counterparts.
